meanings.sent1: The gators in the swamp were sunbathing on the muddy bank.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of gators swimming in the river.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to steal an egg from the gators' nest.
meanings.sent4: The gators' eyes gleamed like jewels in the dark water.
meanings.sent5: The loud roar of the gators echoed through the marsh.

meanings.definition: Gators: Shortened form of the sports team name 'Florida Gators.'
meanings.sent1: My friend is a huge fan of the Gators and never misses a game.
meanings.sent2: The Gators won the championship last year.
meanings.sent3: The Gators' mascot entertained the crowd with funny dances.
meanings.sent4: The Gators' victory parade filled the streets with cheers and confetti.
meanings.sent5: Wearing the Gators' jersey, he felt like part of a winning team.

meanings.definition: Gators: Informal term for shoes made from alligator skin.
meanings.sent1: She proudly showed off her new gators at the party.
meanings.sent2: The expensive gators gleamed under the store lights.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his gators were so fancy, even alligators would envy them.
meanings.sent4: Her gators were as sleek and stylish as a runway model.
meanings.sent5: The gators felt smooth and luxurious against her feet.
